content:
this is a single endpoint from an open api spec document
it has been minified by removing unnecessary kvps
additionally common terms have been abbreviated  operationId: GetUserCredentials path: https://gateway.stackpath.com/identity/v1/users/{user_id}/credentials content: params
name userid
desc a user id
in path
required true

type str

desc the number of items desired

desc the cursor value after which data will be returned
in query
required false

type str

desc sqlstyle constraint filters

required false

type str

desc sort the response by the given field

sum get all api credentials

desc information about a paginated response

this is modeled after the graphql relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination
results
type arr
identityusercredential
type obj
props
id
type str
desc an api credentials unique identifier
name
type str
desc an api credentials name

api credential names are typically associated with the users application and operating environment
clientid
type str
desc an api credentials oauth2 client id
createdat
type str
format datetime
desc the date an api credential was created
updatedat
type str
format datetime
desc the date an api credential was last updated
desc user api credentials

api credentials are used to generate authorization tokens for use with the stackpath api generating api credentials creates a client id and secret client secrets are exposed to the user only once on creation and are not stored at stackpath please record your client secret after generating api credentials

stackpath recommends using one set of api credentials per application and operating environment
desc the requested user api credentials
desc a response from a request to retrieve a users api credentials
title: 4_Authentication_GetUserCredentials_21.json
